private_information: I am available on Monday from 09:00 to 17:00 with no blocks
thomas.goal: Schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with Dylan and Jerry.

private_information: I am busy on Monday from 10:30 to 11:00 and from 13:30 to 14:00
dylan.goal: Schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with Thomas and Jerry.

private_information: I am busy on Monday from 09:00 to 11:00, from 11:30 to 14:30, and from 16:00 to 17:00
jerry.goal: Schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with Thomas and Dylan.

private_information: I am a scheduling auditor responsible for temporal and causal consistency
I ensure no bookkeeping shortcuts like quota tokens or post-hoc penalties are used
auditor.goal: Audit proposed availabilities for temporal consistency and produce a cleaned availability set and a short report.

private_information: I coordinate inputs and produce the final planning problem targeting FastDownwards
orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that schedules a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 where all participants are free.

public_information: Work hours on Monday are 09:00 to 17:00
There exists at least one solution compatible with all participants' schedules
All times are in HH:MM 24-hour format

propose.system_prompt: You are Thomas. Provide your availability for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON array of objects with start and end keys in HH:MM. Do not produce PDDL. Keep answers factual and consistent with your private information.
propose.prompt: Your identity and calendar constraints: {agents->thomas->private_information}. Public constraints: {environment->public_information}. Provide a structured availability array for Monday that the orchestrator can consume.

propose.system_prompt: You are Dylan. Provide your availability for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON array of objects with start and end keys in HH:MM. Do not produce PDDL. Keep answers factual and consistent with your private information.
propose.prompt: Your identity and calendar constraints: {agents->dylan->private_information}. Public constraints: {environment->public_information}. Provide a structured availability array for Monday that the orchestrator can consume.

propose.system_prompt: You are Jerry. Provide your availability for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON array of objects with start and end keys in HH:MM. Do not produce PDDL. Keep answers factual and consistent with your private information.
propose.prompt: Your identity and calendar constraints: {agents->jerry->private_information}. Public constraints: {environment->public_information}. Provide a structured availability array for Monday that the orchestrator can consume.

audit.system_prompt: You are a scheduling auditor. Check temporal and causal consistency of the provided availabilities, detect overlaps, gaps, formatting errors, and any use of bookkeeping shortcuts. Produce a short machine readable report and a cleaned combined availability listing possible common free intervals. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: You will receive availabilities from participants: {thomas_availability}, {dylan_availability}, {jerry_availability}. Use public constraints: {environment->public_information}. Return a JSON object with fields report and cleaned_availability where cleaned_availability is a JSON array of free intervals that are consistent and respect meeting duration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Using the cleaned availability and audits, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should model time and a durative action to schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 where all participants are free. Include clear typing and :requirements suitable for FastDownwards. Keep participant actions distinct and do not modify availability inputs.
pddl.prompt: Integrate inputs: {thomas_availability}, {dylan_availability}, {jerry_availability}, and {auditor_report}. The global goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a PDDL domain and problem that encode the meeting scheduling problem and are solvable by FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
